intro.description: Decision Support This tutorial describes the basic steps for using the Decision Support feature of Bioclipse.

item.title: Step 1: Open the Decision Support Perspective
item.description:
The Decision Support Perspective is a setup of the workbench which is suitable for the Decision Support feature.
In the top menu, select option Window > Open Perspective > Other... and in the dialog select the Decision Support option.

item.title: Step 2: Open a chemical structure
item.description: In the Bioclipse Navigator, double-click a chemical structure to open it in the chemical editor. It is also possible to edit molecules.

item.title: Step 3: Run the Tests
item.description: The Tests can be run by right clicking in the Decision Support tab or by clicking the "Run all tests" button.

item.title: Step 4: Examine the Test results.
item.description: Each individual test can be examined by expanding it and selecting the results. If the test displays substructures, as for the Signature Significance, then the atoms that belongs to the substructure will be displayed in the chemical editor. Entire molecules will be displayed in the 2D viewer.

item.title: Step 5: Generate a report
item.description: By right clicking in the Decision Support tab it is possible to generate a Report.
